If you would argue that a password hash is something different than a password and that Active Directory stores passwords, I have to say that you're wrong.
Active Directory does NOT store passwords!!!
Active Directory stores HASHES of passwords, in different hashing formats for backwards compatibility, i.e. the MD4 hash. When you turn on password hash synchronization, AAD Connect changes the MD4 hash into a SHA-2 hash and sends it to Azure.

So, with Password hash synchronization, both onprem and in Azure are password hashes. You don't want that, because it's only allowed to store passwords (i.e. password hashes) on premise.
